## Required Packages

Before starting, install and load these essential R packages. The installation uses the [Pacman package](https://trinker.github.io/pacman/vignettes/Introduction_to_pacman.html)

```{r}

if (!require("pacman")) install.packages("pacman")

pacman::p_load(ggplot2, sf, readr, dplyr , here , ggthemes)

```

## Import Data

The shape files are stored on my github and you can download them with this code below.

```{r}

##  load shapes

regions_sp <- readr::read_rds( 
  here('blog/Maps in R/data/regions_sp.rds'))

district_sp <- readr::read_rds(here('blog/Maps in R/data/district_sp.rds'))

water_sp <- readr::read_rds( here('blog/Maps in R/data/water_sp.rds'))

```

## Uganda's Region Map 

```{r}
ggplot()+
  geom_sf(data = regions_sp)
```

### Theme the Map

```{r}

regions_map <- ggplot()+
  geom_sf(data = regions_sp, 
    , color = "black", 
    fill = "#f8edeb") +
    geom_sf_label(data = regions_sp, aes(label = F15Regions), size = 1) + # Adjust size as needed
  theme_map()

regions_map
```

### Add water bodies 

```{r}

regions_water_map <- ggplot()+
  geom_sf(data = regions_sp, 
    , color = "black", 
    fill = "#f8edeb") +
    geom_sf_label(data = regions_sp, aes(label = F15Regions), size = 1) +
    geom_sf(data = water_sp, fill = "#8ecae6", color = "#8ecae6") +# Adjust size as needed
  theme_map()

regions_water_map 

```
